templates.name: Steve Magness Marathon Training Plan
templates.author: Steve Magness
templates.description: Three-phase marathon training with emphasis on lactate threshold work, hill training, and progressive intensity. Single integrated plan with flexible weekly mileage ranges.

prerequisites: Experience with hill work and intensity variations
target_audience.weekly_mileage_range: 60-130 miles per week depending on phase

phases.name: Base Period
phases.description: Build aerobic foundation with threshold work and hill training

phases.name: Pre-Competition Period
phases.description: Increase intensity with MP work and varied threshold sessions

phases.name: Competition Period
phases.description: Race-specific work with MP progression and taper

program_structure.training_week_structure: Monday through Sunday with quality sessions typically Tuesday/Thursday/Saturday or Sunday

key_principles: Progressive intensity development through three phases
Emphasis on lactate threshold as foundation for marathon pace
Hill training for strength and power development
Strategic use of double runs (AM/PM splits) for higher mileage days
Variety in workout formats to develop multiple systems
Long runs with progressive elements (surges, MP segments)
philosophy.workout_distribution: Quality sessions typically on Tuesday, Thursday, and long run day (Saturday or Sunday). Recovery/easy runs fill remaining days.

LT.name: Lactate Threshold
LT.description: Comfortably hard pace sustainable for 20-60 minutes, slightly faster than marathon pace
LT.guidance: Roughly 15-20 seconds per mile faster than MP

Steady.name: Steady Pace
Steady.description: Controlled aerobic pace, between easy and threshold

3k pace.name: 3K Race Pace
3k pace.description: Current 3K race pace or effort, faster than 5K

workout_notation.double_runs: Format '9mi/4mi' indicates two separate runs (typically AM/PM split). Athlete chooses split timing.
workout_notation.hill_sprints: Short explosive efforts, typically 10 seconds uphill with full recovery jog down
workout_notation.progressive_efforts: Phrases like 'down to 5k effort' mean start faster and progress to 5k pace. 'at 3k down to 1mi' means progressively faster.
workout_notation.split_notation: '30min split LT' means 30 minutes total of LT running, broken into intervals
workout_notation.surge_notation: 'w/ 10x60sec surges' means incorporate 60-second pickups during the run
workout_notation.alternating: 'alternating 6mi 400m' means alternate between 6 miles steady and 400m at specified pace
workout_notation.strength_circuit: Strength Endurance Hill Circuit is athlete-defined based on experience
workout_notation.recovery: Recovery runs are easy conversational pace. 'Off/short recovery' means optional 0-5 miles.

weekly_schedule.notes: Base period focuses on aerobic development. Note: warm-ups/cool-downs not listed but should be added.

weekly_schedule.monday: 12x200 at 3k down to 1mi pace w/ 200m jog

weekly_schedule.tuesday: 15min LT, 3min rest, 2x5min uphill (10k effort), 2x3min uphill (5k effort) w/ jog down recovery
weekly_schedule.friday: 5mi easy, alternation 9mi of 800m(just slower than LT)/800m (MP)

weekly_schedule.wednesday: 5x4min uphill at 10k down to 5k effort w/ 3min easy, 6x8sec hill sprints

weekly_schedule.tuesday: 10-16x200 at 5k down to 1mi pace w/ 200m jog
16mi hilly run- progression from easy to just faster than MP
7mi at MP w/ 1min surge down to LT every mile

weekly_schedule.wednesday: 7mi easy w/ 5-10min pickup to MP at the end

adaptation_guidelines.mileage_flexibility: Weekly mileage shown as ranges (e.g., '70-80', '110-120'). Athlete chooses based on fitness, recovery, and training history. Maintain consistency within chosen range.
adaptation_guidelines.double_runs: Notation like '9mi/4mi' indicates two separate runs. Typically split as AM/PM. Athlete determines split timing based on schedule. Generally used when daily mileage exceeds 10-12 miles.
adaptation_guidelines.recovery_days: 'Off/short recovery' means optional 0-5 miles easy. '8-10mi recovery' is prescribed easy running. Adjust based on fatigue and upcoming workouts.
adaptation_guidelines.workout_modifications: If too fatigued, work with LLM to adjust intensity or volume. Can convert threshold work to steady runs, reduce interval count, or add recovery day.
adaptation_guidelines.race_substitution: Races scheduled in weeks 9 and 12 (15-20K, Half Marathon). These are optional but recommended for fitness assessment. Can substitute time trials if needed.
adaptation_guidelines.hill_work: Hill sprints are explosive 10-second efforts with full recovery. Strength Endurance Hill Circuit is athlete-defined based on experience and available terrain.
adaptation_guidelines.progressive_long_runs: Many long runs include progressive elements (surges, MP segments, progression to MP). These develop race-specific fitness. Start conservatively.
adaptation_guidelines.lactate_threshold_emphasis: LT work is foundational. Split notation (e.g., '30min split LT') means total LT time broken into intervals. Rest periods between reps are brief (1-3 minutes).
adaptation_guidelines.warm_up_cool_down: Note indicates warm-ups and cool-downs not listed but should be added to all quality sessions. Typically 10-20 minutes easy running.
